content: the head and feet need to be placed in certain stitches to give the dinosaur the correct shape there is a photo tutorial after the instructions to assist row 1 using the body colour single_crochet 6 into a magic_ring 6 stitches row 2 *increase in every single_crochet* repeat around 12 stitches row 3 *increase in next single_crochet single_crochet 1* repeat around 18 stitches row 4 *increase in next single_crochet single_crochet 2* repeat around 24 stitches row 5 row 5 is an increase to 30 stitches but we are also adding 4 x feet in as well for this row i have typed every stitch individually bobble single_crochet increase single_crochet bobble single_crochet increase single_crochet single_crochet single_crochet increase single_crochet bobble single_crochet increase single_crochet bobble single_crochet increase single_crochet single_crochet single_crochet increase single_crochet 30 stitches push the bobbles inside out so they are poking to the outside of the work summary row 5 foot 4 single_crochet foot 9 single_crochet foot 4 single_crochet foot 9 single_crochet = 30 stitches row 6 *increase in next single_crochet single_crochet 4* repeat around 36 stitches row 7 single_crochet around all stitches 36 stitches head still using body colour we will make the head next the head is its own small round and we aren t working around all the body stitches from here please read through the head instructions before starting head a crochet 5 single_crochet and stop in this row we are going to check the placement of the head to make sure that it will be crocheted in the middle between the two feet i added this step because everybody crochets at a different gauge if you have ever made a toy that ended up with lopsided limbs or a crooked head you will understand what we are doing here head b look at the 4 feet imagine there is an invisible line that runs all the way through the middle of the feet up to the top is your current single_crochet in that middle stitch if yes great if not crochet however many single_crochet you need to get into that stitch now move your stitch marker there to indicate the new end of the row your stitch marker is now in the centre of where you want the head to be head c we are going to create a little round at the end to make the head single_crochet 4 count backwards and slip_stitch into the 7th single_crochet from the hook three tips here if you are having trouble - if you have a second stitch marker temporarily put it in the stitch you need to slip_stitch into it makes the correct stitch easier to see - pinch the two sides towards each other with the 7th stitch next to your hook - your hook needs to go from the outside to the inside have a look at the hole/space that was created this new little circle is made up of 7 stitches 6 single_crochet and one slip_stitch this is our new round we are going
